instructions: Connect your phone to your computer using the USB cable. From any home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings . Tap Tethering & Networks . Tap the USB tethering switch to turn on. When the First Time User window appears, tap OK . If your PC uses Windows XP, tap Download Windows XP driver , follow the on-screen prompts. Windows 7, Windows Vista, and Linux systems will automatically download required drivers. For the latest information on operating systems and tethering, go to www.android.com/tether .

From any home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings . Under NETWORK CONNECTIONS , tap Tethering and Mobile HotSpot . Tap Mobile HotSpot . Plug in the USB cable between your computer and your device. Tap USB tethering . This places a green check mark next to the entry and activates the feature. If prompted, read the on-screen notification about data use and tap OK .

From any home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings. Under NETWORK CONNECTIONS , tap Tethering and Mobile HotSpot . Tap Mobile HotSpot . Tap USB tethering to remove the check mark and deactivate the feature. Remove the USB cable from the device.
